label: Diana the Weeekend Warrior
narrative: Only work in open-source on occasion and in spare time. Started out as a way to learn new things for fun. I contribute to a couple of small packages and impactful features in other projects related to my underlying ecosystem. I have niche knowledge and experience where I'm highly proficient.

goals: Make contributions within constraints of budget, time, and resources.
likes: Contributing something in the 4h or so per month that can be spared.
Having a life outside of technology is a priority (family, job, friends).
dislikes: Keeping toolchain up-to-date and running since infrequent contributor.
Packaging ecosystem and dependencies, fight with them all the time and consumes as much effort as the impactful contribution to be made.
Maintaining a project, handling dependencies, and keeping things up to date.
Writing tests and other quality control measures, a known gap, but don't want to spend time on it.
Reviewing and reacting to user reports can be challenging.
A minor version bump that is a surprise breaking change.

product: Builds that do not require effort to troubleshoot, research issues, and adjust to change.
education: Does not seek out security-oriented materials and just needs to know what has to be done.
